chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Timothy B Sturm was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance to Victim Impact Panel for 8/19/2015 or 20 days huber consecutive.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
DNA surcharge and Blood draw costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. Blood draw costs to be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) FORTHWITH. Credit for 123 days. Standard release. Last 30 days STAYED for agent's discretion as well as to the huber/straight time.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Timothy B Sturm in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Defendant IS eligible for earned release program. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department -  append to fine. 
- Fine totaling: $1519.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on August 19, 2015 or 20 days jail Huber consecutive.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided ,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation
- 270 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) - credit for 123 days commencing FORTHWITH.   Non-working hours with standard release
Conditions.  Last 30 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the sheriff forthwith
Hearing on August 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Timothy B Sturm in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense requests another date. Court grants request. Defense to advise how this matter will proceed on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED A $2000.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $2000.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant allowed Huber Bailee Status.
